  • Description: At 0325 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NKX. It was reported that approximately 0.5-gallonsof INTERTHERM 181 GRAY PART A released from a plastic bucket due to improper packaging. The release impacted inside of trailer #3115871. Terminal personnel had proper PPE to handle.

item.title: Report E-2024110167
item.description:
Report E-2024110167

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-31
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 31, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printer ink was damaged by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) To remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums and one (1) 65-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110148
item.description:
Report E-2024110148

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-30
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 30, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printer ink was damaged during offloading and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents and utilized hand tools to work them in. The crew then utilized a cleaning agent and absorbent pads to remove the residual staining from the site. All printing ink impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum then staged onsite

item.title: Report X-2024110338
item.description:
Report X-2024110338

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-26
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Inner contents: 4 plastic bottles (labeled Lime A Way, Lime and Scale remover, 7930-01-224-3159). 2 were leaking from the bottom, appearing to have been punctured by a sharp or protruding object. The package was placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2024100528
item.description:
Report E-2024100528

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-08T12:22:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: Nashville
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/9/24, at 04:37 personnel in the CSXT Radnor discovered SHPX221329, a residue tank car of Butadiene, leaking from top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, BASF, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-1009-00030). Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the B-end liquid valve partially open and the Drylok-style secondary securement not containing the release. Contractor personnel closed the valve and stopped the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative (Scott McDonald, 409 981-5133). The car was subsequently held at Radnor Yard until the secondary closure was replaced and an OTMA-1 was submitted and approved by the FRA.
